text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Być może najlepszy Berliner jaki piłem. Niesamowity poziom intensywności owoców, cytrynowo-marakujowa kwaśność, totalnie pyszne i orzeźwiające.
Tap @ Sour & Bitter #3, 2016. Cloudy red body with a small pinkish head. Yeasty, soap, cheese, red berries, wheat, salty, synthetic. Decent.

750, capped. Thanks, J! Hope I got the right guy. Pours a clear and insanely lurid pink, truly a color not found in nature outside of the most elaborate tropical blooms. If even there. Bright tangy sweet nose, a little lemon and light dry vinegar but then tons of bright clear fruit. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly sweetened cereal under a thin bite of lemon and vinegar and then tons and tons of bright quenching fruit. Unbelievable showcase of flavor for the ABV. Light crisp finish.
Had this at Where The Wild Beers Are VII (2016). Pours a clear pink garnet with a thin pink head. Passion fruit, acid, funk, fruit. Acid. Lovely. Medium bodied, tangy fruit, acid, sweet and tangy.

From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and slight citrusy. Mellow fruity and crisp hoppy. Lingering crisp hoppy. Mellow fruity. Citrusy and smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy and bitter far finish.

Tap into a whiskey glass showing translucent dark jello red with no head. 

The nose is bursting with juicy passion fruit and tropical fruit notes. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Extremely tart with light flavors of passion fruit. A bit too tart.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (18/02/2017) - red coloured pour with white pinkish head. Aroma and taste is medium sour citrus fruity and wheaty with prominent resonating passion fruit, crisp light malt, yeast, tart tropical fruity finish.
Draft. A red beer with a pink head. The aroma has notes dragonfruit, malt, and brettanomyces. The flavor is sweet with notes of dragonfruits, malt, and brettanomyces, leading to a tart finish.

Draught at Himmeriget.
Hazy red colored with notes small off-white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of dragon fruits and passion fruits.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of passion fruits and dragon fruits.
Tart finish
Small and short lived white head. A bit too fruity and more like juice than beer and a bit too salty. Too Hypec

@rbb: pours pourple, haze with pinky foamy head. Aroma-flavors: intense fruity notes, which takes on dragonfriuits, pinneapple, papaya, some other tropical fruits, also tart apples..flavor dont follow intensity of aroma, but still very pleasant restrained funky, sour, hint of grain wheat and dry sour finish. Body is medium? Texture almost juicy smooth, carbonation is medium.

At RBBest. Pours clear dark pinkish purple. Aroma is red fruit, passion fruit, and indeed dragonfruit. Medium body, quite sour, but also tart, crisp and refreshing. Sour palate, but still fruity. Very tasty. And this has only 3.5% ABV? Unbelievable!

From tap at Sour&Bitter 2016. Pours a HUUUUGE 5!! Luminiscent ruby-purple-pink with a pink head. Aroma is sour, fruity, herbal, light lactic, passion fruit, kiwi, freakin soda. Taste is sour, light crisp, lovely chemicals all over, nice and fresh, though the aroma is more exciting than the flavor. High carbonation and a light, crisp body.

Bottle opened up at the 2016 Ottawa Year-end Gathering. Mostly clear rose pour with a similar colour head. Considering this was from the first bottle run pretty impressed with how fresh it seems, lots of dragonfruit with some raspberry and passion fruit, light lemon, hint of funk, really easy to drink with a refreshing tartness, mild vinegar. Mild carbonation and body although full of flavour, dries out and leaves lingering mixed tropical fruit with a balanced tartness. Yummy.

Keg at Route CBC, CBC Clapham, 02/10/15. Attractive bright fluoro purple / pink / red coloured pour with a lasting frothy pink head. Aroma is nice tangy passion fruit, citrus, raspberry berry fruits, little woody. Flavour is composed of tangy passion frit, spicy lemon tart, raspberry, hint of wood in the finish. Palate is crisp, highish carbonation, zippy. Very good.

Draft Third of a Pint at Route CBC Festival at Craft Beer Co, Clapham, London in Oct 2015 - Clear Red/Pink in colour. Small White/Pink head. Mega fruity aroma. Intense Fruity flavour; tart and tangy berry fruits, some citrus and hints of cherries. Juicy fruits tart and sour throughout. Ends quite dry. Tasty and very refreshing. Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific super-fruity Berliner! (2015-10-02)

Bottle: Poured a copper/pink color beer with a medium size foamy head. Aroma of raspberry vinegar with some ripe mango notes is quite unique. Taste is also a mix of ripe fruit notes with some mango and other tropical fruit notes with some tart and raspberry vinegar notes. Body is full for style with good carbonation. Unique take on the style and something I wish I could drink again.
Looks gorgeous. its a strong color. pink head, dark red appearance. Sulphur aroma but thats it. Very thin, raspberry juice. Decent and honestly its way prettier than it tastes.

Bottle at Xmas 2016 gathering, thanks Stephen! Pours pink, some head and some lacing. Nose is tart, farmhouse. Notes of tart lemon, yeast, horseblanket, grapefruit. Taste medium tart, light sweet. Sticky body, light carbonation.

A rosey copper Weisse with a thin white head. In aroma, beautiful sweet fruity tropical fruits, mango, dragon fruits, papaya, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with loads of tropical fruits, oily mouth feel, light tartness, light Epsom salts, very nice. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2016.

Pours unclear peachy red. Good white head. Smell is dry, mild sour. very typical berliner weisse. Not too much fruit here. taste is dry, sharp, fruity. very dry ending. mild sourness. Dry fruityness as well as dryness from the style. bit green ( vegetable) as well.
Tap at Sour & Bitter 2016, so many times. Wonderful berliner, tart with loads of fruit. Wonderful.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of wheat, tart, red fruit and cherry. Soft taste of sour fruit, cherry, passion fruit and a long fruity sour finish. Great berliner.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ HopisHop B.U.M.B. 2016. Waxed bor! Lol. Clear lightly pink, little pink head. Nose is lightly dusty maybe some age, big acidic lemon juice sour, vinegar, sour vinegar, low fruit. Taste is basic lemon sour acidic vinegar, low dust, low sour berry fruit which reminds me neither of dragonfruit which I think tastes of barely anything or passion fruit, low sour berries. Acidic lemon sour body. Nice, there is fruit but laregly it is just massive sour lemon. Neat but below what I expected, didnt see this much lemon juice & bit of vinegar comming.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a somewhat hazy pale red with a small pink head. Aroma of tropical fruit. Taste is passion fruit, dragonfruit, citrus, and berries. Very, very tasty.

Bottle shared by Daniel. Thank you!

Bright pink body with a thin, off-white collar that fades immediately to nil. Aromas of passion fruit, guava. Grandiose fruit character leaps out in the aroma. Tart, hard candies of assorted tropical fruit. Absolutely delicious.
Pours cloudy magenta color with light pink head. Tropical fruit aroma. Tart dragonfruit and passion fruit flavors. Light body with average carbonation. Very nice.

Draught @ [ Sour & Bitter #3 by Drikkeriet ], Atelier 1B - Gastronomisk Innovation, Frederiksborggade 1B, 4th, Copenhagen, Denmark 1360. [ As J. Wakefield Dragonfruit Passion Fruit (DFPF) Berliner Weisse ].Unclear matt dark red color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, passion fruit, dragon fruit, fruity. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a long duration, baking yeast, dragon fruit, passion fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]

How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Hazy red colour with a minimal pink head.
Aroma: Sour, passion fruit, tropical fruit, some lime.
Body: Light body but still with a full mouthfeel, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet, tropical fruit, passion fruit, some tart, citrus.
Pink pour with a smaller head. Dragonfruit and Passionfruit verymuch at the forefront of both the aroma and taste, and in abundance. Lighter lemon and yeast notes, lactic sourness. Excellent
aroma magnificient. pinkish orange colour. smooth for a berliner. stupid drinkable.

This is the best beer Ive ever had.
Look, Taste, Feel, Aroma.....Everything is perfect!
I could drink this all day anyday.

750 ml bottle via OG Society. Pours a barely cloudy reddish pink with a small head that dissipates completely after a short amount of time. Tons of fruit, Im assuming the two fruits in question, with berries and lemon, as well. Light-bodied, with modest carbonation and a citric, tart, fruity mouthfeel. Not particularly acetic. Really, really fun stuff. Could drink this all the time.
Bottle - Fruity, juicy and intense dragonfruit. Clearish pinkish. Big fruity dragon notes and a nice tart dry finish. Superb.

Pours berry red in colour with a white/pale pink head. Picking up the passionfruit aroma right away with something extra tropical. But I also find it very rosé forward along with something lightly lactic. More vinous than I could have emagined. The taste is pretty intense and wonderfully dry and sour. Seriously tropical again, finishes dry with a superbly sour aftertaste. Mouthwatering and clean, almost mineral. Impressed.

The color of this pour is like a light and "clean" rusty red, with a small ever so slightly pinkish white head. 
Aroma has passion fruit written all over it. Dragon fruit, slight salt, some mineral/vitamin like notes, slight mixed red berries, quite the tropical Thunder. 
Taste is, at first, quite lactic and sour, which mellows quite a bit, and becomes more freshly squezed fruity sour, with sligt sweet fruity notes. 
Semi-medium bodied, with a rather flat carb. This is like a mix of lemonade and rose - adult lemonade for sure, and perfect for this summer weather.

Kegerator pours at a tasting then 750mL bottles from Wakefields OG Society. Tap pour was smelling a tad acetic like pickled beets, vinegar. Taste is sweet and sour with beets and lemons playing off. Not so great. Bottle pour was a major improvement thankfully. Neon pink pour with hot pink foam. Super seedy passion fruit nose. In taste, sour and seedy passion fruit with good sugar balance so as not to be too citric/lemony. Acetic character is absent here. Its bright and refreshing. It hits all the right marks, but I like Miami Madness better.

ABC Dutch Summer Tasting. Sampled from bottle kind courtesy of RandomStrangerNL. Fluorescent hazy magenta with a bubbly ring head. Strong fruity nose, explosive passionfruit, falling into fruity blackhole, sweet raspberry, sour berries, something remiscent of cheesecake. Sweet, tart, light salty. Over medium body, supple sappy juicy feel, just amazing fruitiness.

Bottle at only Dutch summer day tasting thanks to RandomStrangerNL. Bright neon pink with light neon pink head. Massive fruits with passion fruit, light melon, red berries and probably dragon fruit though Ive never had that. Just loads of fruit with some light dough and minerals. Almost medium sour with a bit of bitter fruit pits and a hint of salt. Medium bodied with creamy feel and a lot of soft champagne like bubbles. Great.
Pours vibrant red lilac witrh a good pink head. Aroma is great dragon and passion fruit sour and fresh. Flavor as aroma just an explosion of fruits in your mouth.

At Torst, NYC. Gorgeous juicy red, deep clean and inviting. Absolutely insane, unique, amazing aroma. Complex fruit, sweaty and pungent. Round fruit up front. Powerful clean juice, rounds out a little tart. Very juicy aftertaste. Very tasty and hitting on all cylinders.

On tap at the brewery. Originally reviewed 5/16/2015.
Deep pink. Like a very bright red. Pink head. Settles to just a collar.

Huge passionfruit aroma. Pretty much dominates the nose.

Strong lactic sourness. Passionfruit sourness. Juicy in the middle. Almost no grain flavor to it. Finishes with lingering sourness.

Light. Intense sourness. Medium low carbonation. 

One of the standards of the Florida Weisse style. This beer has scaled up well. Im sure some people will complain that it isnt as sour as it used to be, but thats actually an aspect I appreciate about the transition to the brewery system.

[5/12/16] Draught at Sour & Bitter #3 in Copenhagen. Beautiful deep red-purple. Amazing aroma of passion fruits, carambola, other fruits, lacto. Sour flavor, great, full of fruits, lacto, slightly acidic in the throat. Medium-bodied. Wonderful.

Poured a beautiful bright pink with a pink head. Aroma was of insanely fresh passionfruit, nothing really else to say there. Big passionfruit juice in the flavor, fairly tart, not sweet at all. Great stuff.

From tap at Sour & Bitter #3, Copenhagen. Hazy neon red color with pinkish head. Aroma is fruity, passionfruit, berries - raspberry, light spicy, some beetroot notes. Sweet and acidic taste, tart fruity like aroma. Light to medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

Tap @ Sour and bitter #3 . Had a few of these. Pours hazy pink with a purple head - I mean this looks like something you would serve to a birthday party for kids and I love it! Aroma of passion, kiwi-like dragonfruit, lactic tartness, salt, sour candy and a slight herby note as well. The taste has tons of fruit which includes the passion, kiwi kinda notes, dragonfruit, salt and a somewhat creamy lactic tartness. Very nice!

Tap @ Sour & Bitter #3, Copenhagen. Had several pours during the night. Pinkest of pink pours with a pink head. Super juicy with tons of passion fruit, subtle lacto and some dragon fruits. Super good!

Tap @ Sour and Bitter 3. Pours... you know how it pours. Luminescent pink with an insanely saturated purple head that turns lighter pink over time. Best looking beer Ive ever seen by far. Aroma is lactic, lemon zesty, berries, passion fruit, mango, kiwi. Taste is lactic, berries, huge passionfruit sweetness and tartness, lemon zesty. Whoa.

Draft at Capones event. Poured hazy magenta with pink head. Nose was dragon fruit, passion fruit, tart lactic acidity. Tasted crisp, fruity, with pronounced DFPF flavor, and finishing earthy tartness. This one is every ounce as good as advertised.

12.05.2016, tap @ Sour & Bitter #3:
Nice purple creamy mediumlasting head, deep reddish color. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish, sorrel, weeds, passionfruit, grass, minerals, passionfruit stones, berry skin, mild vinegar. Taste is slightly sweet sour-ish fruity, red berries, passionfruit, minerals, berry skin, mild vinegar, watermelon, fruit stones, sorrel. Medium bitterness, acidic mouthfeel. Very nice.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Sour and Bitter 2016. Red with a lasting pink head. Nice aroma of mixed red berries. Dry and tart berry juice flavour with a hint of grain.

Vibrant pinkish red with a pink head. Aroma is passion fruit, dragon fruit, beets. Light bodied, lightly tart on the palate with a fruity finish. Taste is fresh passion fruit, dragon fruit, fruity tropical fruit fruit. Fruity.
Tap sour and bitter. Pours hazy deep red with a pink head. Aroma of tart, fruity, passionfruit, dragonfruit, red currents almost raspberry alike. Taste is quite tarty, fruity and fresh.

Keg. Hazy deep red with a medium sized diminishing pink head. Light earthy, acid, red currants, vanilla, rhubarb. Light bodied, little sweetness, medium sour. Refeshing, fruity. I drank a lot of this.
Pours a bright fuchsia with a light pink head. Aroma is all passion fruit. Taste follows, sour and fruity. Very nice
Draft at Capones. Pours beautiful fusha with some foam that fades quickly. Aroma is dragon fruit, mild vanilla and fruit cocktail. Taste is similar with strawberries and a dry finish. Amazing!
Fuscia color. Nose and taste are passion fruit, some earthiness and somewhat vegetal (which somehow works, very well).

I dont understand the hype here. I like the beer: strong citrus, high carbonation, grapefruit (communion style) beverage however it makes me pucker with every sip. At 3.5% abv and $14/8oz it better pay may Styx my toll.

On tap at Fools Gold 4/1/16. Pours a super bright purple/pink w/ bright rose head. Aroma is passionfruit, citrus, apple, tart berries. Flavor is tart lemon / berries, oak, grape, raspberry sherbet. Light body, crushable... Really great.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 On tap for Tørst 3rd anniversary party. Pours a glowing cloudy bright hot pink. Lighter hot pink head. Quite a beautiful beer. Aromas of funky sourness and a tad bit of tropical fruits and grains. Taste is pretty sour. More than I was expecting actually. Less riots sweetness than I anticipated too. Interesting. Still a great Berliner. I wish it wasnt going to snow later and it was a hot summer day.

3/12/16. Sampled during the 2016 Hunahpus Day. Pink pour with a small pink head. Fruity aroma, lactic, sour, acidic, doughy, plentiful of the aforementioned fruits. Good flavor, sour, acidic, lactic, doughy, milder tropical fruits than the aroma led on. Tasty.
Pinkish pour with white head. Nose of tart fruit and citrus. Taste of tart passion fruit and lemon. Delicate mouthfeel. Very well done.

25.4 oz bottle. Clear crimson pink with a white film. Nose is tart passion fruit and wheat with light lactic funk. Creamy with a perfect sour bite and lingering fruit. Taste is sour passion fruit, green apple, raspberry and lime. Comparable to the great lambics in depth and complexity.

Draft at Wakestock 2016. Bright bright red with tropical aromas bursting out the glass. Soft sourness offset by the juicy fruit and the passionfruit really shines in this. Drinks easy and is very refreshing. The crisp finish begs to drink more.

Bottle at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share. Lovely bright red. Nose of berry, passion, dragon fruit, seeds. Tart, lactic flavor, overwhelming fruit. Tart and tropical, very seedy though, lemon, yogurt. Good but not as mind-blowing as the reputation had me expecting.

(750ml bottle) the brightest red Ive ever seen, fine white/pink bubbles. Nose of passion fruit and dragon fruit, mildly tart, juicy and delicious. Taste is medium tart, tons of fruit, juicy pulp and skin, amazingly delicious palate linger. Great fruited sour.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Bottle at Ryans Nov. 14th, 2015 tasting; courtesy of Ryan. Glad to try this again - originally had this a few times at Cigar City, Hday and the Florida Berliner Bashes, but my ratings were always taken down. This batch is a bit different and important to note that the original batches were 5.0/5.0. Pours a super bright pink with white lace. Pretty crazy coloring. Nose is passion fruit all the way. Mouthfeel is dry, tart and sour with notes of passion fruit, sour lemons, cereal and grains. Where the finish was absolute juice in the first few batches, this time around theres much more grain/cereal character present which is a bit grating on the palate. Still a fine beer though, and a great berliner. Bring that juice. RERATE::: Again at GABF 2016. It seems the draft/kegged version of this beer is materially better than the bottle. Most notably, I dont get as much cereal grains in the finish as I remember tasting from the bottle - much juicier as well.  One of my favorite berliners and  passion fruit beers, period. Yo Wakefield, can you send me a keg of this for my wedding?

OG grej Randall var så snäll att vara behjälplig att få hit. Tack!
Med Isabel, Sofia, Mac (och Arnold). 
Rönnbär bär frukt
Rönnbärssyra. Bärsyra
Läskande lättdrucken
Rakt fram. Frisk och ren. Ingen komplexitet direkt. Hemma hos Mac

November 27, 2015. Bottle.

Hazy red with a small light pinkish head.

Aroma is dominated by passionfruit, some gooseberries and lemon juice, and a very light sweetness with peach and dragonfruit (?).

Taste is tart and very fruity, very light sweetness.
Finish is lots if tart and juicy passionfruit, gooseberries, lemon juice. Light bodied, average carbonation, dry texture. 


Very nice passionfruit forward berliner.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you GT2! Pours very hazy vibrant red with a frothy pinkish white head that leaves lots of 

sticky trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity with crackers, passion fruit, lemon juice, lime juice, 

dry soil, minerals, kumquats and lemon zest. Taste is sour and heavy fruity. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, mouth-puckering and 

medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, passion fruit, lemon juice, yoghurt, hay, minerals and lemon zest. HEavy 

passion fruit forward and heavy sour. This is very good but the home brew version we tried a year ago beats this both in 

the insane apperance and crazy heavy fruitiness.

Bottle at Ratebeer Kvillebäcken Winter Gathering, 151127. Hazy reddish color, nice offwhite/pinkish head. Sourish passion fruit aroma, dragon fruit, bready, grapes, peach, some oranges. Sourish passion fruit flavor, dragon fruit, citrus,some peach. Nice fruity Berliner, full bodied for the ABV.
A: Red/pink/purple nice head N: Passionfruit, lime, dragonfruit T: passionfruit, gooseberry, cranberry O: Wow! Love the taste of this! Packed with fruits and very well balanced!

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottle, pours an insane purple pink. The color is fake looking. Smell is vinegar, sour mustard, perfume passionfruit, dragon fruit, finish is wheat and cereal. Not a fan of this berliner for most part. Tried again on tap at capones, much better lots of passionfruit and dragonfruit. Really tart and tasty. Pours the color of a translucent beet. Really nice

Bottle and on keg @ Wakefield Brewing. Beautiful electric red pour with a large frothy pink head. Ridiculously fun appearance. Nose is interesting. Musty, meaty rhubarb. Plenty of grapefruit meat and tropical seagrass. Bright and appealing. Flavor is simple but pretty tasty. Sweet/tart tropical citrus fruit salad. Mellow acidity. Plenty of carbonation. Light body. Good stuff.

2nd October 2015Craft Clapham. Keg. Route 66 event with most of the London crew. Hazy pinl - magenta beer, small pale cream colour head. Sour berry fruits. Lemon acid. A touch of that burned hazlenut that is often to be found in Danish sours. Light finish. Its fine.

Draft on tap at the OG Party (Miami, FL). Though Ive had this on tap at previous events under Cigar Citys name. Finally able to rate it. Pours a deep alluring purple reddish hue, pinkish dragonfruit glow with decent hazines, frothy pinkish head atop is solid, sits around and laces well enough. Frothy and inviting. Aromas are tropical, passionfruit and dragonfruit meet starfruit, guava, kiwi and tropical melange. Dry and twangy lactic appeal, earth and nice fruity edge. Delicious. Initial bursts of fruit, dragon fruit and jabs of fruit punch, tart lacto, citrus and passionfruit melange, cool and subtle sweetness as we press on. Fruity and prominent, the same distinct play between aggressive dragonfruit that overwhelms the passionfruit a bit (but that prevails in the end). Sweet, sour, and punchy. A light enough body to drink far more than anyone should need to. Punchy and aggressive dragonfruit, some guava, that passionfruit preaches more into the backend and finush. A wonderous pour as usual, fruity punchy nose and delicious flavors and flow make this a winner. An amazing beer. Perhaps the bottles differ but at the source (Last keg of 2015), nothing beats this bad boy.
On draft. Purple pour, with thin to no head. Berry, sour, moderate passion fruit, tropical fruit, grapefruit, lemon, and mild wheat. Nice fruit beer, not exceptional.
Pouted a pink color from the bottle with the aromas of light tart wheat, some dragon fruit and light passion fruit. Flavors match the aromas with light fruit and acid and lacto in the aftertaste.

Keg at Route CBC, 3.5%. Cool to try this, a legendary recipe in Ratebeer terms. Dark vibrant reddy purple, still, small foamy tan head. Aroma has lots of the promised passionfruit, jam tarts, raspberry jam. Body is light, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is sherbety and tart, lime, passionfruit, soft acidity. Minty burps. Good.

Tap at Route CBC, London. Deep red. Some foam atop. Aroma is pretty interesting. Red winey, jammy mixed berries, summer fruits, pulpy tropical fruits. Taste has loads of fruits and an unusual kinda cracker-y grainy snap to it. Quite acidic. Very nice, but not mindblowing.

Tap. Pours neon clear deep pink with intense pink head. Aroma is very sour, fruity, yoghurt, passionfruit, acidic, tart berries. Taste has more sweet dragonfruit and turns sour and more passion fruitlike.Super fresh! Juicy cranberries, some wheat, light dry and complex long dry finish. Many red currants in there too. Very sour and nice edge from tart wheat. And nice tangy feel from passion fruits towards the sweet dragonfruit.

Aroma: red berries, grapes, peach and citrus fruits. Appearance: hazy red, no head. Taste: heavy sour. Palate: sour grape juice, tart, citrus flavours again. Overall: very nice Berliner Weisse, nice grapefruit juice flavours. 
Pint at CBC, Clapham.

Keg at Craft Beer Co. Clapham - London, during Route CBC. Pours clear, radioactive purple-pink with a creamy, white head. Rich, fresh tart berry aroma, with some passion fruit notes. Light sweet flavor, bracingly acidic, drying, with tart berries and lemon juice. Light bodied with average, spritzy carbonation. Tart on the finish with blistering acidity, some cereal notes, melon, dragonfruit, cherry. Not bad, but the cereal/grain notes in the finish and aftertaste are a little off-putting. Overall, though, tasty and rather enjoyable.

Tap at route CBC. It pours crazy bright pink-red with a small pink-white head. The nose is soft, fruity, definite dragon fruit, cherryade, jammy fruits, jam tart, tropical fruit punch and passion fruit. The taste is crisp, tart, juicy, bursting with fruit, dragon fruit, earth, cherryade, some acidity, tangfastics, sour cherry, jam tart, passion fruit and blackcurrant cordial with a dry, tangy finish. Light body, fine carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Very juicy and fruity. Tasty.

Keg at Route CBC. One of my beers of the festival. Colour is bright purple to pink, small white head. Nose is huge fruity berry extravaganza, dragonffruit, passion fruit, fruit berry tart and sour, fruit punch, bit of blackcurrant. Taste is big burst of fruit punch, dragonfruit, passionfruit, blackcurrant, some acidity, slight sort of wood barrel mustiness, some aicdity and berry tartness. So light and refreshing hard to find the beer in here but its great.

Keg at route CBC, London. clean ruby color with minimal light pink head. Aroma is sour and fruity with notes of sour cherries and raspberries. Taste is sour acidic with lemon juice, tart cherries and raspberries. Overall, very nice but Miami Madness is superior

Keg at Route CBC, CBC Clapham, 02/10/15.
Light cherry red with a decent crimson cap.
Nose is jammy red berry, light spice, passionfruit, light acidic whisper, lemon jam, balsa wood.
Taste comprises tare red berry, raspberry, passion fruit licks, hint of bretty vanilla, pink berry sherbets.
Medium body, fine carbonation, semi drying close with moderate puckerings.
Solid berry Linner.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On draft at JWB during the Florida Weiss bash. Pours a mostly clear and bring pinkish purple color and topped by a thin film of pink foam that quickly fades and leaves little to no lace behind. Looks beautiful. The aroma is incredible showing huge notes of sweet passion fruit and tart, funky dragon fruit to go with some light citrus acidity and the sour mash base. The fresh fruit really dominates and smells amazing. The flavor is quite tart and aciditic from the fruit with the tart dragon fruit and sweet passion fruit melding together beautifully and bringing so much fruit flavor to the beer. It leans more to the tart side especially with sour base beer, but there is just enough fruit sweetness to balance things out. Amazing all the fruit flavor that they were able to get in this thing. Light to medium in body with ample carbonation that lends to the tartness and leads to a lengthy fruity finish with a touch of acidity as well. Thirst quenching and delicious as each sip begs for another. Just an amazing fruited Berliner Weiss that is straight forward and perfectly executed and just as good as the other times Ive had it. Really great beer.

From notes. Enjoyed on September 19 at Travis house. This 750 mL beauty was offered up by Mike. Holy damn. It pours a bright vibrant purple/pink with a thin collar of purple-ish head that vanishes quickly leaving no lace. The aroma is something else. It smells like Hawaiian Punch at the first sniff, and it only gets better from there. There is a nice sour tartness that works with the fruit punch. I love dragon fruit and passion fruit, and they work so well in this baby. The flavors are like that Hawaiian Punch, only a lot better. Its not as syrupy, just light and crisp. The fruits are beautiful. Its not complex, but delivers exactly what its supposed to. This is an amazing Berliner. The mouth feel is also light and crisp with a slight tart sour on the finish. The carbonation is light and bubbly, but carries it just far enough. The aftertaste is lingeringly fruit punch based with a lovely sourness. I need more of this beverage.
Bottle. Beautiful beautiful ruby red color! Aroma is tangy Hawaiian punch. Taste us very tangy passion fruit juice slightly sweet.

Thanks to Jackl for sharing this one. So, the packing is ridiculous. I have no idea what the image of the girl and the animal head is supposed to be, and the red wax doesnt even match the purple image. Not that any of that matters. Bright red, clear color. I get rhubarb and grapefruit. Lightly sour, heavily carbonated which I enjoy, so good marks on the palate. Some salt, and a little melon. It is good, but surprised to see the numbers it is getting.
750ml, waxed bottle (that actually made shipping). Poured a hazy purplish clor with a smaller sized pinkish tinted head. Fruit juice. Perfect summer and session-able beer. Tart finish.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Really bright pink/red blended color, and it really does match the color of when you think of passion fruit . The smell was tart berries. The taste followed the nose with some fruit in the nose and finish with a bit tartness

Bottle shared by Jack, thanks! Pours a clear bright reddish pink with a white head that starts and remains at the edges. Aroma has a bit of a vegetal note with a sweet and tart passion fruit note, a bit of rhubarb and a light wheat. Flavor has a vegetal and rhubarb combination with a bit of wheat underlying.

Bottle shared by Jackl - thanks and welcome to MN! Beautiful hot pink fusia pour with a slight white head. Nice nose, some odd veggie notes then massive passion fruit. Medium sour, big fruit explosion. Woah, quite nice.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Bottle shared by Jack, thanks. Pours bright reddish color, almost neon. Aroma is mostly fruit, taste is more tart. Rhubarb and grapefruit flavor, very good.
Bottle shared by jackl - thanks! Rich clear reddish pink pour. Awesome looking! I get straight rhubarb in this. And I love it. Fantastic!
(Un échantillon au Stone 19th Anniversary): Extrêmement juteux, betterave, gazon frais, acidité moyenne et une bonne corpulence relative.
Sour, green apple no passion fruit. Acetic acid mostly some,nail polish some dry apricot finish but mostly sour acid.

After reading all of the horror stories about this beer leaking in transit, I was setting myself up for disappointment. Boy was I wrong. DFPF is one of the more unique sours Ive been able to try and was almost full blown fruit juice, with just the perfect amount of sour quality.
Glowing bright magenta. Insanely intense fruit flavor. More fruit than actual dragon fruit. Medium sour on the back end. Amazing.
great color, nice fruity nose, just a great example of a fruited Berliner.

Really bright pink/red blended color, it does match the label color. The smell was tart berries. The taste followed the nose with some passionfruit in the finish and a bit of tartness. Quite drinkable

Rating #7000 and have been really looking forward to trying this one! Beautiful pour as they say, vibrant neon pink purple with a pink head. Thankfully this is definitely not one of the bad bottles. Aroma is massive fresh passion fruit with a light balanced melon and light lychee dragonfruit character behind. Flavour is light to light moderate sweet, moderate sour and a little salty. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation. This really lives up to what I hoped it would be, the most incredible fresh fruit, just amazing!  Such a shame that some people got a bad bottle and had a negative experience of this amazing beer.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Clear pink pour. decent pink head. Dragonfruit & passionfruit aroma and taste. Very very good

Pours a magnificent bright pink from the bottle. Very earthy and slightly fruity aroma. Quite lacto tart passion fruit sourness, some spice from dragon fruit, with a dry, acidic finish. A very unique & awesome Berliner!

Bottle thanks to Matt; no wax on the pink cap, but it looked pefectly seated and leakless, so I was hoping for greatness. Upon cracking the cap, an intriguing exotic tropical aroma wafted out, telling me i was on the good side of the tracks. The beer pours candy apple / neon pink, a truly amazing color. Lots of little suspended floaties of you hold the glass to the light. Small pink head and good lacing. Aroma is fruity, passionfruit is obvious and in your face. Hints of jalapeno as well as something odd and exotic. Flavor is light sweet, hugely fruity, light tart, lots and lots of passionfruit, a bit of mild jalapeno as well. Light plus body, spritzy carbonation. Really interesting and unique.
Bright, clear, pinkish red. Bell pepper and passionfruit, earthy. Tangy, pepper and passionfruit flavors dominate, another guy mentioned sauvignon blanc and I see that too. So, so good.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Paul @ Cajun Café.
De couleur rougeâtre quasi pourpre profond et trouble, col crémeux rosé.
Arôme au bouquet superbement bien fruité, énorme à ce niveau surtout pour une Berliner, fruit de la passion avec une note de fruit du dragon sapparentant au kiwi qui perce en rétro. Retrouve un côté terreux, légèrement aigre.
Palais est énorme qu niveau fruité, superbement bien balancée sans être surfait mais aussi sans avoir un fini lactique trop présent, retrouve ce côté sour mash de Berliner et un assemblage parfit des fruits. Fine note aigre à chauqe gorgée ponctuée pr un très beau profil tropical.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 Re-rate: The Hawaiian punch of beers. Pours a nice magenta color with a short lasting off white head. Aroma is all passion fruit, as is the taste. Super delicious and a nice surprise after having one of the leaky bottles from last year.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2015 Third time having this thanks to Drewfaec. This bottle was the best, no signs of leakage and no off flavors. Super easy drinking with just the right sourness. Get the fruitiness and some earthy characteristics. Really great.

Re-rate of DFPF bottle after opening possibly infected bottle. Bottle wax was red and no signs of any problems. No holes, no leakage, looks perfect. Beer pours an inviting red color, not much head. Aroma has hints of fruitiness, tart, not vegetal, but has some interesting fruity aromas. Taste is dry, fruity, tart, get some of the passion fruit. This is leaps and bounds better than the bottle homer shared. Still get some weird aromas, but the taste is nice. The fruitiness is nice, and tartness is not overpowering. I do get some strong overpowering acidic tones in the back of my throat as I drink more. I dont think I could finish an entire bomber of this. Hope the bad bottles are far and few in between.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Updated after a second tasting: Pours that same bright fuchsia with a small white cap. Aromas are much more appealing this time around. Loads of passion fruit. Taste follows with a punchy tang from the passion fruit.  Dragon fruit seems to be an afterthought. Still, a crisp and juicy beer here. Nice dry finish with a good pucker. Not quite as good as Miami Madness for my tastes but a very enjoyable beer, none the less.                                                                                                        

Bottle sent to me by Laz. Thanks a bunch!! Red wax on the cap. Poured into a tasting glass. Gorgeous pour of bright fuchsia/hot pink. Small white head that fades to fine lacing. Aromas are pretty abrasive! Lots of acetic acid, butter, under-ripe fruit, diapers, cabbage.....yea, not at all what I was expecting. Taste follows the nose, unfortunately. Lots of mustard seed flavor, sharp acetic acids, rotten cabbage, under-ripe fruits....pretty messy and certainly containing flavor profiles that were not intended to be here. Slightly oily in mouthfeel and light bodied with fine carbonation. Finish is dry, puckering and basically a culmination of the abrasive aromas into one final dose of deep funk. I usually like the funk, but this was not harmonious. I dont think anybody was able to finish their glass. A shame. 

Tough to write this review, as I was very excited to try this beer! I am sure this is not how the brewer intended it to taste though. A shame, considering some of the high marks it has received. Maybe one day, I will be lucky enough to try a better bottle of this one!

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Rerate bottle thanks to JW himself. Bright purple to pink in color. Medium pink head. Aroma is lychee, orangeish, maybe some lemon. Light acidity.  Taste is like tart fruit loops. Very fruity and just the right amount of balanced tartness. Finishes with a light acidity in the throat. Fruitiness lingers on after the finish. Really good stuff.

Draft... This beer rocks! Pours deep purple with a big pink head that quickly dissipates. Big-time citric, fruity aroma - the passionfruit shines here, but the dragon fruit also chimes. Medium-bodied and lightly creamy with lively carbonation. The flavor is tart up front, then sour and fruity, and then tart and tangy on the backside. Heaps of fruity flavor here. This is pretty much in line with other batches of DFPF Ive enjoyed. Maybe a little more acetic acid and graininess in this batch. World class Florida Weisse!

From the Pilot Series review to this, great to finally review the real thing. Ive had several batches of this beer, and the thing that sticks out is the brilliantly bright pink color. Beautiful beer. The newer batch dials down the sourness, which as JW can attest, thats a good thing for me. With less acidity the sour balances out the fruit a touch better than previous batches. Great beer.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Bottle. Pours purple ruby - Perfection - Almost no head. Nose/taste of passionfruit, sour lactose, sour wheat - a bit acidic upfront and then a punch of fruit in the back end. Lighter medium body - World class.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Bottle. Well this looks absolutely gorgeous, purple Ruby pour with white head. Full passion fruit in your face. Flavors are long lasting sweet and tart fruit, full passion fruit.

Pours pinkish to a red color with tiny pink bubbles that dissipated quickly. Big nose of dragon fruit. Just a huge dragon fruit taste with tartness to it in the middle fading to the passion fruit on the back. Lacks some carbonation but I think it had to do with my bottle. Will rerate this again if the next bottle has some more bubbles but this is still seriously world class stuff. If I could drink this everyday I would and never get tired of it.

On tap at the brewery. Rich pink colour. Big pink head that collapses quickly. Big fruity aroma, especially passionfruit. Tart front, sweet fruity middle, tart finish. Very well balanced. Depth of fruit flavour. Im an experienced DFPF drinker and this is in line with the best of the other batches Ive had.  Still a unique American berliner.

Thanks for sharing Shad! Beautiful light cherry/dark pink pour, probably the best looking beer Ive ever seen. Aroma and taste is distinctly passion fruit, perfectly tart without any overwhelming acidity. The tropical fruit taste stays with you, in a good way. Congrats to J. Wakefield for a home run first bottle!

Bottle thanks to Ben. Pours a gorgeous pink with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong passionfruit and wheat. Thin mouth, tart, strong passionfruit, nice puckerness, really amazin stuff.

750-ml bottle (thanks, JPDurden24 for sharing this gem). Wow, it has a funky floral and fruity nose of sweet passionfruit, spoiled melon, Hawaiian Punch, and dark cherry. Gorgeous color of dark hibiscus pink and deep ruby topped by pink froth. Lovely sweet-and-sour combo of tart tropical fruit (kiwi and acidic ruby red grapefruit) and a powerful passionfruit sweetness with a slightly astringent wheat tone. A seriously incredible brew thats very refreshing.
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2015 Smell is intense tropical fruit. Taste is a huge punch of tropical fruit and a huge punch of wheat. Lively carbonation with light to medium body and no foam.

Well JW, you did it. And its as good as ever. Fluorescent pink/fuchsia pour. Pink head. Wow. The fruit is amazing. The sourness is perfect. I dont know how you can have a better Berliner than this. Wow.
A beautiful bright dark pink color with a small white head. Aroma of wonderful tart passion fruit and just awesome light sour and tart fruity flavor. A wonderful and awesome Berliner.

Appearance- one of the most beautiful beers you will ever look at... Violet deep ruby

Aroma- Im not that familiar with dragonfruit but Ive been told this is good representation of the smell with a subtle pickle-ey smell.

Taste- your mouth Immediately gets a berry / fruity flavor followed by lacto sourness

Overall- my first official Florida-weisse and Its perfect and I hope its not the last. I wont be surprised if this is the best one because I hear Wakefield is the king of Berliners

I need a pair of sunglasses to drink this blazing, bright violet and pink drink. The color is worth the price admission, but the taste and smell with the combination of the passionfruit and dragon fruit are unreal. Nicely balanced with some tartiness and a little pucker. Phenomenal is all I have to say, JW.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Thanks to Shad for this one, Very similar to the Cigar City pilot version, the nose is strong dragonfruit and passionfruit, very juicy. So well that its difficult to tell what sourness comes from the fruit and what is from the berliner. This is a common characteristic throughout the beer. The color, is bright light red. A little of the flat side, which is due to the caps leaking. Taste is all fruit, with berliner in the background, tart finish. Wow, this is delicious. So glad to have gotten to try this again, thanks Shad!!!

The aroma is pure fresh dragonfruit with the hint of tartness from the Berliner weisse. Color is hot magenta pink. One of the prettiest beers I've ever seen. Clear. Little to no head. Taste is great balance of exotic fruit and tart Berliner. Mouthfeel is great. One of my favorites!

---Rated via Beer Buddy by Me
A perfect berliner with ideal tartness and palate with a perfect treatment of dragon fruit and passion fruit. Looks amazing...tastes amazing. Legitimately one of the best beers on the planet.

On tap at the brewery for DFPF Day. Deep ruby pour with a pinkish head. Sour berry bouquet. Tart and tangy with sour berry/exotic fruit highlights. Its somewhat hard for me to describe the undercurrents. Hints of lacto, malt, and yeast I think. Maybe some vinegar in there too. Damn, this exactly what a Fruited Florida Weiss should be; tart and sour but tasty and refreshing. Very good body and mouthfeel. Bravo JW.
